topics.title: MOSFET Heat-up Calculation
topics.description: time equals charge divided by current

topics.title: MOSFET Switching Speed and Frequency
topics.description: time equals charge divided by current, double round trip time

attempts:
Here is a high-level table of contents for the video:

**I. Introduction**

* Overview of selecting a MOSFET and designing a circuit for it

**II. Heat Management**

* Calculating the current draw of the load
* Determining the maximum switching frequency
* Calculating the heat dissipation of the MOSFET
* Conclusion: the MOSFET is not going to overheat

**III. Switching Speed**

* Calculating the charge injection into the gate
* Calculating the time it takes for the MOSFET to turn on
* Calculating the maximum switching frequency (2 MHz)
* Conclusion: the MOSFET can handle the switching speed required

**IV. Design Considerations**

* Back EMF and bulk capacitance requirements
* Other considerations for a brushed motor driver (not specific to MOSFET selection)

**V. Conclusion**

* Summary of key points in selecting a MOSFET and designing a circuit for it
* Future video suggestions and next steps

Note: This is a high-level outline, and some details may have been omitted or condensed for the sake of brevity.
